org.strongback.components

Interface Counter

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Zeroable

    @ThreadSafe
public interface Counter
extends Zeroable
    A simple counter that is safe to be concurrently used (both get() and increment()) in one or more threads.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Counter circular(int maximum)
      Create a new counter that will increment by 1 and that upon reaching the supplied maximum value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to 0.
      static Counter circular(int initial, int increment, int maximum)
      Create a new counter that will increment by the specified amount and that upon reaching the supplied maximum value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to the given initial value.
      int get()
      Get the current count.
      Counter increment()
      Increment the counter.
      static Counter unlimited()
      Create a new counter that will monotonically increment by 1 and upon reaching the maximum integer value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to 0.
      static Counter unlimited(int initial)
      Create a new counter that will monotonically increment by 1 and upon reaching the maximum integer value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to 1.
      Counter zero()
      Change the output so that the current value is considered to be 0

    • Method Detail

      • get

        int get()
        Get the current count.
        Returns:
        the current count; will never be negative

      • increment

        Counter increment()
        Increment the counter.
        Returns:
        this object to allow chaining of methods; never null

      • zero

        Counter zero()
        Description copied from interface: Zeroable
        Change the output so that the current value is considered to be 0
        Specified by:
        zero in interface Zeroable
        Returns:
        this object to allow chaining of methods; never null

      • unlimited

        static Counter unlimited()
        Create a new counter that will monotonically increment by 1 and upon reaching the maximum integer value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to 0.
        Returns:
        the new counter; never null

      • unlimited

        static Counter unlimited(int initial)
        Create a new counter that will monotonically increment by 1 and upon reaching the maximum integer value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to 1.
        Parameters:
        initial - the initial value for the counter; must be 0 or positive
        Returns:
        the new counter; never null

      • circular

        static Counter circular(int maximum)
        Create a new counter that will increment by 1 and that upon reaching the supplied maximum value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to 0.
        Parameters:
        maximum - the maximum value for the counter before it resets to 0; this must be positive
        Returns:
        the new counter; never null

      • circular

        static Counter circular(int initial,
                        int increment,
                        int maximum)
        Create a new counter that will increment by the specified amount and that upon reaching the supplied maximum value will upon the next increment() call automatically reset to the given initial value.
        Parameters:
        initial - the initial value for the counter; must be 0 or positive
        increment - the value by which the counter should be incremented when increment() is called; must be positive
        maximum - the maximum value the counter can achieve; must be positive and greater than initial
        Returns:
        the new counter; never null
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if initial or resetValue are negative, or if maximum is less than or equal to initial, or if increment is not positive
